title: Steady Growth in the KCP Portfolio Despite a Slowdown in Sector-wide Lending
summary: As macro conditions shift, how are KCP portfolio companies adapting and staying resilient? Let’s connect at to discuss. With key macro indicators turning favourable for India, such as moderating inflation, stable crude prices, and a steady US dollar, the KCP portfolio has seen...
fullContent: As macro conditions shift, how are KCP portfolio companies adapting and staying resilient? Let’s connect at https://shorturl.at/QcrPS to discuss. With key macro indicators turning favourable for India, such as moderating inflation, stable crude prices, and a steady US dollar, the KCP portfolio has seen the benefit of supportive conditions. Our emphasis on high-quality financials with healthy asset quality and consistent growth continues to reflect in steady performance. While overall loan growth in the sector has moderated, KCP lenders remain ahead of the broader banking space and have maintained resilient asset quality. Our bottom-up investment approach has led to selective additions across home finance, microfinance, and fintech, keeping valuation discipline in focus. #KingsOfCapital #Marcellus #Finance

title: Disposable income and spending growth : Overall trends and effects from fiscal stimulus
summary: Disposable income and spending growth tend to follow similar long-term trends, as shown in our FRED graph above. Over the past 15 years, real disposable personal income growth and real personal consumption expenditures growth have averaged just over 2.5% year-over-year.

title: With 'Big Beautiful Bill,' U.S. to Reverse Course on Clean Energy
summary: The Republican spending bill, signed into law Friday, will reset the course for the U.S. energy sector, analyses show. The law rapidly phases out tax credits for wind, solar, and electric cars, while making it cheaper to drill and mine for fossil fuels on federal lands.

title: Performance at that the half year mark - nothing expected
